intro: Pomaderris coomingalensis, commonly known as the Kangaroo Island Pomaderris, is a shrub native to South Australia. It belongs to the Rutaceae family, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its small, aromatic leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to the dry, coastal climate of its native region. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
